intro: Brachyscome mittagongensis, commonly known as the Mittagong daisy, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
